intro: Gymnosporia montana var. samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan mountain gymnosporia, is a shrub native to the island of Samoa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, woody fruits. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, adapting to the tropical climate of the region. Its botanical features include rough, hairy stems and yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
